greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of 6-core partitions of n.
comment: Expansion of q^(-35/24) * eta(q^6)^6 / eta(q) in powers of q.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (terms 0..1000 from T. D. Noe)
F. Garvan, D. Kim and D. Stanton, Cranks and t-cores, Inventiones Math. 101 (1990) 1-17.
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( prod( k=1, n, (1 - x^(6*k) + x * O(x^n))^6 / (1 - x^k)), n))}
(PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^6 + A)^6 / eta(x + A), n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 24 2003
